title: Maison Pickle

title: Black Barn
description: Black Barn is an American restaurant serving local, artisanal food in the comfort of a modern barn setting.

title: Philippe by Philippe Chow
description: A sophisticated, upscale restaurant known for its vibrant energy, attractive crowd and award-winning Beijing cuisine.

title: Cheeseboat - Hell's Kitchen
description: Family-owned Georgian bistro offering traditional comfort food dishes.

title: Boqueria - Upper East Side
description: A lively, Barcelona-inspired tapas bar that serves Spanish classics, seasonal specials, and curated cocktails in a vibrant and contemporary space on the Upper East Side.

title: The Ivy Room
description: The Ivy Room is a modern, swanky take on the NYC piano and cocktail lounge.

title: Jalao
description: Escape from the streets of New York City to the brightly colored paradise of the Dominican Republic while dining at Jalao.

title: Obicà Mozzarella Bar Pizza e Cucina
description: Obicà represents genuine Italian style with a friendly welcoming atmosphere, bold design and outstanding Italian regional cuisine.

title: Hunter's Steak & Ale House
description: Enjoy traditional dishes like homemade crab cakes, chicken wings, lobster tails and a variety of steaks and hearty fare.

title: The Consulate UWS
description: The Consulate  features a French-American menu, while executive chef Alan Vargas curates a special menu each month spotlighting a new country’s cuisine.

title: Perrine
description: Perrine, the recently re-imagined restaurant at the iconic Pierre Hotel, offers seasonally-inspired fare and daily specials of vintage Pierre classics.

title: Footprints Cafe Nostrand
description: It’s all about the Rasta pasta at Footprints Café, a \Jamaican eatery owned by Robert Gordon, who hails from the island nation.

title: Mister French
description: Mister French NYC is a French supper club with a New World spirit, designed with an emphasis on group dining and entertainment.

title: Brasserie Cognac East
description: Brasserie Cognac East brings authentic Parisian charm to the Upper East Side.

title: Violette's Cellar
description: Violette’s Cellar offers social dining, gourmet food and eclectic decor, with a seven-days-a-week brunch menu and a dinner menu made for sharing.

title: Rustic Pizza & Pasteria
description: Rustic Pizza & Pasteria offers authentic, flavorful, well crafted pizza and pasta as well as other Italian specialties seven days a week.

title: Monterey
description: Simon Oren, Dudi Sasson and chef James Tracey bring midtown Manhattan a glamorous bold American restaurant: Monterey.

title: Kubeh
description: Kubeh, a Greenwich Village restaurant dedicated to lesser known cuisines of the Middle East, is the product of chef Melanie Shurka and husband David Ort.

title: Rosemary's East
description: This walk-in restaurant in Peter Cooper Village brings Rosemary's warm design, accessible menu of seasonal Italian dishes and neighborly hospitality to Manhattan's east side.

title: Sojourn
description: Sojourn embodies the spirit of culture in the Upper East Side's sexiest restaurant.

title: Barbetta
description: Owned by the same family for more than a century, Barbetta’s ornate décor and lush, fanciful back garden (replete with stone fountain) make it the most romantic Italian around.

title: Fig & Olive—Downtown
description: Spacious, light-filled and located in the trendy Meatpacking District , Fig & Olive on 13th Street is ideal for lunch and dinner.

title: Beauty & Essex
description: Hidden behind a functioning pawn shop, Beauty & Essex is a true gem on the Lower East Side and widely regarded as one of New York's most beautiful restaurants.

title: Le Rivage
description: This traditional French restaurant is located in the heart of the Theatre District and has been operated for over 25 years by the Denamiel family.

title: City Winery
description: City Winery's flagship location includes two performance venues, a restaurant that includes a pizza bar and coffee roasting station, and a tasting room.

title: Chazz Palminteri Italian Restaurant
description: Chazz Palminteri's features the finest meat, seafood and pasta dishes, as well as antipasto and traditional Italian desserts.

title: Celeste
description: This neighborhood trattoria has been a reliable Upper West Side standby for a number of years.

title: Buddha-Bar New York
description: The manu at this new New York City outpost of Buddha-Bar features Asian fusion dishes ranging from Japanese, Chinese, Thai and Southeast Asian flavors and dishes.

title: Aperitivo
description: Aperitivo is an Italian-American restaurant near Central Park that serves thin crust pizzas, homemade pastas, and other Italian dishes.

title: Taste of India II
description: Taste of India offers a sophisticated fine dining experience with effortlessly charming staff and discreet service.

title: Rosa Mexicano - Lincoln Center
description: Setting a standard in authentic Mexican cooking since opening its doors, Rosa Mexicano now has three locations throughout NYC.

title: Rosa Mexicano - Second Avenue
description: Rosa Mexicano serves up Mexican goodness in an authentic yet stylish and festive atmosphere.

title: Kyma
description: Dine on pristine seafood at this upscale Greek restaurant.

title: SenYa
description: At SenYa, diners enjoy dishes made with fresh ingredients prepared with originality and creativity by the exceptionally skilled chef, Weeneng Choo.

title: Smyth Tavern
description: Smyth Tavern serves American tavern fare in the heart of Tribeca, featuring fresh fish, raw bar, dry-aged steaks, homemade pastas and a specialty burger.

title: Gran Morsi
description: Gran Morsi, named after the Italian word for “bites,” epitomizes elegant simplicity.

title: Sofrito on the Hudson
description: After throwing back a mojito in the dimly lit bar—where rows of liquor bottles are sleekly backlit in blue—and savoring authentic and affordable Latin American cuisine, you’ll quickly get the feeling that you’re not on Sutton Place anymore.

title: Sona
description: Chef Hari Nayak's creations at Sona take diners on a tour across India, but with locally available ingredients.

title: HanGawi
description: Slide off your shoes and sit down on a comfortable pillow at this fine-dining establishment serving Korean-inspired vegetarian cuisine in Manhattan's Koreatown.

title: Hancock St
description: Hancock St is a dinner-only neighborhood spot from restaurateur John McDonald and chef Ryan Schmidtberger.

title: Stella 34 Trattoria
description: This modern Italian trattoria and bar on Macy’s sixth floor boasts soaring ceilings and beautiful natural light, not to mention impressive views of the Empire State Building.

title: Leuca
description: Inspired by Southern Italy, Leuca is a neighborhood restaurant from Chef Andrew Carmellini's NoHo Hospitality Group serving house-made pastas, wood-fired pizzas and rustic dishes in a sunlit corner space in Williamsburg.

title: Lafayette
description: Lafayette, a French restaurant in downtown Manhattan's NoHo neighborhood, is at once a gorgeous dining destination, vibrant nightspot and delectable French bakery.

title: Amuse Bouche Bistro
description: Amuse Bouche Bistro provides a selection of tempting treats, quiches, soups, sandwiches and bistro fare, plus finely brewed coffees and teas, within La Marqueta in East Harlem.

title: Armani/Ristorante 5th Avenue
description: Chef Michele Brogioni translates Armani's tasteful philosophy to include simple yet enticing dishes like gnochetti with red mullet, Treviso radicchio salad and prized Ligurian Taggiasche olives.
8282 is a light-hearted, fresh take on Korean food on the Lower East Side.

title: Hortus NYC
description: The modern Asian cuisine at Hortus NYC reflects global influences.

title: Khe-Yo
description: This TriBeCa restaurant offers Laotian cuisine from chef Marc Forgione and partner chef Soulayphet Schwader.

title: Sarabeth's Central Park South
description: At Sarabeth's Central Park South, you’ll find contemporary American food, a warm atmosphere and the friendly service Sarabeth's restaurants are known for.

title: Kurant Wine Bar
description: This inviting neighborhood wine bar serves dozens of red, white and sparkling wines by the glass and bottle.

title: La Pulperia
description: La Pulperia, modeled after the general stores found throughout South America, features rustic Latin cuisine with European influences.

title: The Independent
description: The Independent is a snug and stylish space for notable drinks and food in Times Square, not far from Broadway theaters, the Garment District and Bryant Park.

title: Il Mulino New York | Uptown
description: Il Mulino New York serves expertly crafted dishes with unparalleled service, emphasizing authentic Abruzzese preparations.

title: Il Falco
description: Chef-owner Bolivar Perez has decades of experience cooking Italian fine cuisine.

title: Red Rooster Harlem
description: Marcus Samuelsson's restaurant focuses on elevated American comfort food.

title: Recette
description: Recette is a lively French bistro in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, featuring tasty dishes and unique specials by executive chef Alan Vargas.

title: Indian Table
description: Indian Table showcases the flavors, herbs, spices and cooking techniques of Goa, the coastal Indian state once colonized by the Portuguese, with a distinct British influence.

title: Il Mulino Prime | Soho
description: Il Mulino Prime stays true to the Abruzzese heritage of farm-fresh meat, fish and vegetables, served with the highest level of personal attention.

title: Ixta
description: At Ixta, located on the Bowery on Manhattan's Lower East Side, chef Francisco Blanco brings the flavors of traditional Oaxacan cuisine with an elevated twist.

title: Jue Lan Club
description: Occupying the historic Limelight space, this elegant Flatiron restaurant serves Asian food with modern touches.

title: Strip House Midtown
description: Strip House Midtown brings all the Strip House signatures to a bi-level space on 44th Street that offers lunch, dinner and private dining.

title: Empire Steak House - West 54th Street
description: This second Empire Steak House opened by the Sinanaj brothers showcases modern decor in a classy but trendy atmosphere.

title: La Bonne Soupe
description: La Bonne Soupe is certainly a place for a hearty bowl of French onion soup, but its name comes from a more obscure origin—the title of a popular avant-garde French comedy that ran in Paris in the 1950s, starring Jeanne Moreau.

title: Frida Midtown
description: Frida Midtown is a Latin Fusion restaurant offering a creative menu of Mexican-Peruvian cuisine.

title: Bixi
description: Bixi offers dishes and drinks that are packed with unforgettable flavors and served by a knowledgeable, friendly staff.

title: Rossini's
description: Located in charming Murray Hill, Rossini's has been serving fine Northern Italian cuisine for more than 30 years.

title: Bar Milano by Eataly
description: Amidst a cosmopolitan ambiance inspired by Italy's most fashion-forward city, enjoy elevated, rich Milanese cuisine, iconic drinks like the Negroni, and more.

title: Addictive Wine & Tapas Bar
description: Addictive Wine & Tapas Bar is a tapas bar/restaurant serving dishes with influences of Spain and other Mediterranean countries.

title: TsuruTonTan Udon Noodle Brasserie - Union Square
description: Japanese udon specialist in Union Square.

title: The Dutch
description: Despite its name, The Dutch isn't Dutch.

title: Limani
description: Limani, the Greek and Mediterranean restaurant in Rockefeller Center, uses only the highest-quality local and Mediterranean seafood.

title: Victor
description: Victor is an easygoing neighborhood restaurant serving light, bright and flavorful cuisine inspired by Southern Europe and the Mediterranean.

title: Altesi Downtown
description: You don't have to go all the way to Italy for authentic Tuscan cuisine—just as far as Spring Street.

title: KYU NYC
description: KYU’s signature dishes include smoked wagyu beef brisket, whole-roasted cauliflower with goat cheese and shishito herb vinaigrette, and its coveted multi-layered coconut cake.

title: Empire Steak House - East 50th Street
description: Empire Steak House's location on the east side has two raised tiers of seating featuring wrap-around booths and a hand-painted dome.

title: Claudette
description: Claudette joins her sister restaurants Rosemary's and Bobo in offering a warm and inviting atmosphere to share great food with friends and family.

title: Takumen
description: Restorative bowls of ramen, sashimi and sushi rolls are served up at this hip izakaya.

title: Periyali
description: This Flatiron favorite was one of the first Greek bistros in Manhattan to offer refined, gourmet interpretations of Greek classics such as spanakopita, mousaka and tomato-stewed rabbit.

title: The Fulton
description: Dine at Jean-Georges Vongerichten's celebration of fresh seafood in the Seaport District.

title: Veselka
description: Find 24-hour comfort food and Ukrainian specialties at this East Village standby.

title: Bar Boulud
description: If you’ve ever wanted to break bread at an avant-garde cavernous wine cellar with your eccentric, well-off French friends, then Bar Boulud is what you’ve been waiting for.

title: Benny John's Bar and Grill
description: Benny John's Bar and Grill is a steakhouse that offers lunch and dinner daily, along with happy hour and bar bites.

title: Omar's Kitchen & Rum Bar
description: Omar’s Kitchen is a nouveau Caribbean restaurant found on Manhattan’s Lower East Side.

title: Rosa Mexicano - Union Square
description: Setting a standard in authentic Mexican cooking since opening its doors, Rosa Mexicano now has three locations throughout NYC.

title: Junoon
description: Junoon's name, meaning "passion" or "obsession," is an indication of the dedication that went into this restaurant.

title: Copinette
description: Midtown East's Copinette serves American cuisine with strong French influences.

title: dhom
description: dhom is a unique dining experience that accentuates the brightness and vibrancy of Southeast Asian food and drinks.

title: Docks Oyster Bar
description: Docks Oyster Bar has been serving the freshest seafood and oysters for more than 25 years in Midtown Manhattan.

title: Lorenzo's Restaurant, Bar & Cabaret
description: Lorenzos Restaurant, Bar & Cabaret serves modern Italian and American fare at breakfast, lunch, and dinner daily.

title: Benchmark Restaurant
description: Located in the heart of Brooklyn's Park Slope, Benchmark features a New American menu focused on pasture-raised animals and locally grown produce.

title: Beast & Butterflies
description: A private oasis perched above Times Square, Beast & Butterflies invites you to lounge and enjoy cocktails and bites in a vibrant atmosphere inspired by the City

title: Gallaghers Steakhouse
description: Back in the prohibition years, Gallaghers Steakhouse served as a speakeasy.

title: Giorgio's of Gramercy
description: A classy, well-rated Italian eatery decorated in beige and burgundy in the neighborhood of Gramercy, Giorgio’s offerings include salad, pasta, sandwiches and entrees such as filet mignon.

title: Bistrot Leo
description: Bistrot Leo, located in the heart of Soho, offers classic French fare from chef Jesse Freijo.

title: Cacio e Pepe - Upper East Side
description: Famous for their pasta mixed in a pecorino cheese wheel, this intimate eatery on the Upper East Side's quiet York Avenue serves authentic Italian cuisine.

title: Baar Baar
description: This dark, clubby restaurant features modern Indian cuisine.

title: Barbalu
description: Stefano Barbagallo and Adriana Luque opened their Italian restaurant in 2013 near the South Street Seaport.

title: TsuruTonTan Udon Noodle Brasserie - Midtown
description: Japanese udon specialist in Midtown.

title: The Queensboro
description: This modern, spacious New American restaurant also has a great cocktail list.

title: Morton's The Steakhouse—World Trade Center
description: Nestled in the heart of Lower Manhattan, located in the World Trade Center, Morton's The Steakhouse is a true blend of classic cuisine and contemporary style.

title: Osteria 57
description: Osteria 57 offers a different kind of Italian menu, combining seafood choices and vegetarian dishes.

title: Pete's Tavern
description: Pete's Tavern is the oldest continuously operating bar and restaurant in New York City.

title: Lido
description: James Beard Award–winning author Serena Bass, Lido's executive chef, creates unique twists on Northern Italian classics on Harlem's "Restaurant Row."

title: Lure Fishbar
description: With decor that evokes a luxury yacht, Lure puts a contemporary spin on its classic fish-house menu.

title: Mable's Smokehouse and Banquet Hall
description: Smoky brisket, pulled pork and St. Louis–style ribs taste authentic and won't set you back too much.

title: Maisonetta
description: Maisonetta captures the true essence of fine French dining and the gastronomy of Mexican flavors and traditions.

title: MáLà Project - 53rd St.
description: MáLà Project is a Michelin Bib Gourmand–recommended Chinese restaurant in Midtown East.

title: MáLà Project - East Village
description: MáLà Project is a Michelin Bib Gourmand–recommended Chinese restaurant in the East Village specializing in Sichuan dry pot.

title: Marseille
description: Taking its name from the port town in southern France, the restaurant, like the town, is a melting pot of influences and ideas.

title: Zero Otto Nove - Flatiron
description: Roberto Paciullo opened the original Zero Otto Nove ("089") on Arthur Avenue in 2008; more recently, this branch has opened in the Flatiron District, and combines the menu of Paciullo's other Bronx outpost, Roberto's Restaurant, with that of the original Zero Otto Nove.

title: Morton's The Steakhouse—Manhattan
description: There are quite a few venerable steakhouses in Midtown, but Morton’s stands tall among them.

title: Chai
description: Chai serves authentic Beijing cuisine, incorporating the cooking techniques the Qing Dynasty's court cuisine to present unique local Beijing dishes.

title: Meet the Meat
description: This highly-regarded steakhouse in Astoria serves prime cuts of meat aged to perfection in a unique way, accompanied by superior customer service.

title: 698 Cafe
description: Located in the heart of downtown Flushing, 698 Cafe serves a vast menu of Cantonese and Szechuan food in an elegant setting.

title: Uva Next Door
description: Seasonal Italian classics and fantastic Amalfi style pizza paired with a cocktail-forward beverage program make Uva Next Door the playful little sister to the original Uva.

title: Treadwell Park - Downtown
description: Treadwell Park’s craft beer hall offers 20 rotating draft beers and ciders, as well as beer in some of the cocktails and ice cream floats.

title: Michael's
description: Michael’s has long functioned as a power-breakfast-and-lunch scene for the who’s who of media.

title: London Lennie's
description: Founded in 1959 by a couple who relocated from England, London Lennie's has evolved into a premier seafood restaurant, now owned by their son.

title: Molyvos
description: It may not be as rejuvenating as a vacation on a Greek isle, but a meal at this high-end Midtown eatery is sure to put you in a sunny mood.

title: Tiny's Cantina
description: Tiny’s Cantina serves contemporary cuisine rooted in Mexican flavors and traditions.

title: NoMo Kitchen
description: NoMo Kitchen offers a rustic American menu with Mediterranean influences helmed by chef Carlos Betancourth.

title: San Carlo Osteria Piemonte
description: San Carlo Osteria Piemonte is a corner of Turin in Soho.

title: Spanish Diner
description: An Iberian take on the classic American all-day restaurant, Spanish Diner features big portions of Spanish favorites in a casual open-air space.

title: Flor de Mayo - Washington Heights
description: As one of the few remaining Chino-Latino restaurants in NYC, Flor de Mayo provides selections crafted by the chef's skillful touch, seasoned with unique herbs and spices from both cultures.

title: The Russian Tea Room
description: This opulent restaurant has been a treasured destination since 1927, serving continental classics in a soaring setting.
